sqlReaderQuery.value:
with rdw_obj as ( 
	SELECT 
		 external_obj_id -- this is an object id outside betl for this object. 
		  , server_type_id 
		  , server_name 
		  , db_name 
		  ,  schema_name 
  	  ,  substring(obj_name, 1, len(obj_name)-2)  obj_name  -- remove last two characters namely _h
	  , substring(obj_name, len(obj_name)-1,2 )  suffix
		  , 20 [obj_type_id]  -- view
		  ,_source
		 , o.[obj_id] src_obj_id -- the source of the latest view is this table
	--select * 
	from dbo.obj_ext o
	where 
	obj_type = 'table'
	and db_name = 'sqldb-rdw'
	and schema_name = 'rdw'
	and o._delete_dt is null 
	and o.is_definition=0
	and substring(obj_name, len(obj_name)-1,2 )  = '_h'
)

SELECT 
	 o.external_obj_id -- this is an object id outside betl for this object. 
	  , o.server_type_id 
	  , o.server_name 
	  , o.db_name 
      , o.schema_name 
	  , o.obj_name
	  , o.[obj_type_id] 
      ,c.ordinal_position -- stays the same
      ,c.column_name
      ,c.column_type_id
      ,c.is_nullable
      ,c.data_type
      ,c.max_len
      ,c.numeric_precision
      ,c.numeric_scale
      ,c.primary_key_sorting -- redefine prim-key
      ,c.default_value -- just copy contents. Do not use source system defaults. 
      ,o._source
	 , o.src_obj_id -- this is the betl internal reference to the main object/table that acted as a source for this object
from rdw_obj o
inner join dbo.col c on c.obj_id= o.src_obj_id
where 
c._delete_dt is null
and c.is_definition =0
